intro: Cyrtandra sphaerocalyx, commonly known as the globe-leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spherical-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
